courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Cell Biology
courses.description: This course helps students build up solid foundation in cell biology for their future research and studies in life sciences. Core modules of this course include: 1. Functions of technology and engineering in advancing understanding of cell; 2. Chemistry and physics of cell membrane and its mechanism of communications and transportation; 3. Endomembrane system and cytoskeleton in intracellular structuring and trafficking; and 4. Mechanisms of signal transduction in cell proliferation and programmed cell death. As the final capstone module of this course, the significance of cell biology in understanding and improving human health and disease will be discussed. Clinical researchers may be invited to share their innovative research design and findings and to inspire our students about the importance of basic discoveries in applied studies.Topics 1-8 introduce students our current understanding about the structures, functions and mechanisms of a number of components in a eukaryotic cell and illustrate how these components interact, leading to cell proliferation and programmed cell death. The final capstone topic “Clinical Application of Cell Biology” inspires the students about how they can apply what they have learned in the previous topics, seemingly fundamental and discrete, in an integrative manner for understanding and improving human health and diseases. This capstone topic will also stimulate the students to think out of the box and realize the significance of basic research in applied studies.Senior Student Mentorship Programme (SSMP) is implemented in this course so that the hundreds of students will be assigned into groups, mentoring by some selected senior students, who have taken this course before with good academic results. Besides sharing their learning experiences and answering their mentees’ questions about cell biology, these senior students, who are mostly engaging in experimental projects in their capstone courses, can also inspire their mentees about the innovation and design of their scientific studies. Clinical researchers are also invited to share their innovative research design and finding and to inspire our students about integration and application of some basic discoveries in cell biology for understanding and improving human health and diseases.
courses.course_syllabus:
Specific topics include: 1. Introduction: Cell Biology & Microscopy; 2. Membranes: Their Chemistry, Structure and Functions; 3. Transport across Membrane: Overcoming the Permeability Barrier; 4. The Endomembrane System: Transport within a Eukaryotic Cell; 5. Signal Transduction Mechanisms: Their Messengers and Receptors; 6. Cytoskeleton: Structures for Maintaining Cell Shape and Internal Organization; 7. Cell Cycle: The Events of Cell Growth and Division; 8. Apoptosis: A Programme to Cell Death; 9. Clinical Application of Cell Biology (Capstone Topic)
具體的主題包括: 1. 簡介：細胞生物學與顯微學; 2. 細胞膜：化學，結構和功能; 3. 穿越細胞膜運輸：克服滲透障礙; 4. 內膜系統：真核細胞內的運輸; 5. 信號轉導機制：信使和受體; 6. 細胞骨架：維持細胞形態和內部組織的結構; 7. 細胞週期：細胞生長和分裂; 8. 細胞凋亡：細胞死亡的程序; 9. 細胞生物學的臨床應用

courses.description: This course provides students with an introduction to the general principles of ecology. The course covers four broad areas: behavioural ecology, population ecology, community ecology and ecosystem ecology. Behavioural ecology examines how behaviour contributes to survival and reproduction. The relationship between behaviour, ecology and evolution is emphasized. Population ecology concerns how populations grow and how they are limited by food, competition and predation. The community ecology component will focus on factors that determine the structure and function of biological communities, including nutrient cycles and biogeochemistry. The course will conclude with a module on ecosystem ecology discussing how ecosystem structure, function and services may be influenced by disturbances. Mathematical models will be used to illustrate the theoretical background for topics discussed.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge
• Understand key concepts in behavioural, population, community and ecosystem ecology (e.g. population regulation, competition and predation, life-history strategies, optimal theories, sexual selection, adaptation, social behaviour, kin selection, food webs, species diversity, community structure, biogeochemical cycles, ecosystem resilience)
• Appreciate important questions and key issues in modern ecology
Skill
• Application of the scientific method to ecological problems
• Understand the concepts of experimental design and hypothesis testing in ecology
• Find and collect information from the primary literature
• Critically analyse information from the primary literature
• Application of modern ecological knowledge to real-world environmental issues and problems
Value
• Understand the factors driving the distribution and abundance of living organisms and their behaviour
• Recognize the ecological basis of global and regional environmental problems
• Develop an ecological perspective of the major global environmental problems (e.g. biodiversity crisis, climate change) and their solutions
知識
• 理解行為生態學、種群生態學及群落生態學中的重要概念（例如，種群調節， 競爭與捕食， 生活史策略，最適性理論，性選擇理論， 適應， 社群行為， 親本選擇， 食物網， 以及物種多樣性）
• 關注現代生態學研究中的重要問題和焦點
技能
• 把科學方法應用到生態學
• 理解生態學中實驗設計和假設證明的內容
• 查找和收集文獻
• 客觀分析文獻
• 運用圖表描述和表達生態學的觀點
價值
• 熟悉現代生態學中的重要問題和重點；
• 熟悉並闡釋全球化的環境問題（例如，生物多樣性危機）
• 認識全球及區域環境問題的生態學基礎
知识
• 理解行为生态学、种群生态学及群落生态学中的重要概念（例如，种群调节， 竞争与捕食， 生活史策略，最适性理论，性选择理论， 适应， 社群行为， 亲本选择， 食物网， 以及物种多样性）
• 关注现代生态学研究中的重要问题和焦点
技能
• 把科学方法应用到生态学
• 理解生态学中实验设计和假设证明的内容
• 查找和收集文献
• 客观分析文献
• 运用图表描述和表达生态学的观点
价值
• 熟悉现代生态学中的重要问题和重点；
• 熟悉并阐释全球化的环境问题（例如，生物多样性危机）
• 认识全球及区域环境问题的生态学基础
courses.course_syllabus:
I. Population Ecology
1. Population growth & regulation
2. Demography
3. Intraspecific competition
4. Interspecific competition
5. Predator prey relationships
II. Behavioural Ecology
1. Introduction
2. Optimal theories
3. Ecology of territory
4. Group behaviour
5. Alternative strategies
6. Altruism
III. Community and Trophic Ecology
1. Diversity, species richness and their measurement
2. Island Biogeography
3. Energy flow in ecosystems
4. Biogeochemical cycles of major elements
5. Methods for studying food chains and food webs
IV. Ecosystem Ecology
1. Patterns of ecosystem development
2. Effects of disturbance on ecosystem structure and function
3. Ecosystem resilience and stability
I. 種群生態學

2. 種群統計學

II. 行為生態學

2. 最適性理論
3. 領域行為
4. 群體行為
5. 其他行為策略
6. 利他行為
III. 群落生態學
1. 物種多樣性及物種豐度
2. 島嶼生物地理學
3. 生態系統中的能量流動
4. 群落穩定性及群落結構

courses.description: This course deals with the fundamental principles of heredity eukaryotes with emphasis on Mendelian inheritance, non-Medelian inheritance, linkage and mapping, structure of DNA/RNA and chromosome, and inheritance patterns of genetic diseases.

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Population Genetics
courses.description: Population genetics is the study of processes underlying allelic changes and evolutionary divergences through which subspecies and species are produced. It is relevant to a variety of disciplines such as conservation biology and systematics. This 1-unit short course will be focused on molecular phylogenetics and its application in population genetics and beyond.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge
By the end of the course, a student will be expected to understand:
1) the concepts of molecular phylogenetics;
2) the procedure of constructing phylogenetic trees with molecular sequences ;
3) the pros and cons of different phylogenetic methods.
Skill
1) To apply existing software tools to construct molecular phylogenies;
2) To use molecular phylogenies to solve biological problems.
Value
Taking this course will equip students with tree thinking for future engagement in many areas of life sciences including population genetics, molecular systematics, evolutionary biology, phylogeography, conservation biology, medical fields and forensic applications.

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Biodiversity Laboratory I
courses.description: This experimental course introduces the diversity, forms and functions of fungi, algae, bryophytes and invertebrates.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Basic techniques in the study of plants and fungi, including aseptic techniques,
2. Culture, isolation and identification of plants and fungi,
3. A firm grasp of the characteristics of algae, lower plants and fungi through examination of whole organisms and slide sections of representative species,
4. An appreciation of invertebrate diversity with an understanding of the general body plan of the major phyla groups of invertebrates (including the ability to identify an invertebrate of the major phyla to the class level),
5. Ability to observe and identify specimens (including using the microscope), draw annotated diagrams to illustrate the structure, and relate structure to function.
1. 研究植物和真菌的基本技術，包括無菌技術；
2. 培養﹑分離和鑑定植物和真菌；
3. 通過觀察具代表性物種的個體和切片，充分掌握藻類﹑低等植物和真菌的特點；
4. 了解無脊椎動物的生物多樣性及各主要無脊椎動物門動物的一般身體架構〔包括能鑒別各主要無脊椎動物門的動物至綱的層面〕；
5. 具備觀察和識別標本的能力（包括使用顯微鏡），並能繪畫註釋圖來說明結構，以及指出結構和功能之間的關聯。

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Human Biology
courses.description: This course introduces the study of man as a zoological species, through the examination of the extant primates and fossils, biochemical microevolution of mankind and embryonic development. The concept that humans, like other biological species, exhibit variations will be dealt with. The importance of these variations in adapting to environmental stresses will be discussed. Much of this course, therefore, will outline the wide range of adaptive power that humans possess with particular emphasis on the plasticity of human adaptability as a factor contributing to the success of mankind. The final part will treat man as a social animal and discuss the possible future of man in the light of his present activities.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: LSCI1002 (Not applicable to Old Curriculum students).

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Palaeobiology
courses.description: Using dinosaurs as an example, this course will introduce the field of palaeobiology through in-person lectures, video lectures featuring overseas museums and remote field sites, first-hand study of fossil material and a field trip to a local fossil site. Students will discover the important roles played by palaeobiology and how it is expected to shape the future of the life sciences. Students will be given the chance to develop their own interests in palaeobiology during coursework, providing a pathway to future undergraduate research opportunities for interested students.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge
Understand what palaeobiology is and its key concepts
Understand the links between palaeobiology and the rest of the life sciences
Recall key features of dinosaur biology and evolution
Understand how palaeontologists reconstruct ancient ecosystems using fossil and modern evidence
Recall the traits and significance of a Late Cretaceous ecosystem
Skill
Understand and communicate what palaeobiology is and its contributions to the life sciences to audiences, with and without a scientific background
Value
Become familiar with how palaeobiology contributes to the life sciences
Appreciate the importance of palaeobiology to the ongoing development of the life sciences.

courses.description: This course provides students with a basic understanding of the various processes involved in growth and development of plants. Topics include plant-water relations, mineral nutrition, transport, photosynthesis, respiration, nitrogen metabolism and signalling, seed germination and dormancy, embryogenesis and organogenesis, reproduction and senescence, secondary metabolites and chemical defense, plant-microbe interactions, hormonal and environmental control of plant growth and development.
courses.learning_outcomes: To give students the foundation knowledge in plant physiology that will enable them to have better understanding to plants and appreciate other related courses within the biology programme and the plant biotechnology programme.

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Invertebrate Form and Function
courses.description: The morphology, ecology, reproduction, development, life history and phylogeny of major groups of invertebrates will be examined. The function of organ systems will be discussed with reference to the adaptations to the mode of life of the animals.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: LSCI1002 or permission of instructor (Not applicable to Old Curriculum students).
courses.learning_outcomes:
The course is one of the “biodiversity” courses for Biology major students, which as a whole introduce students to the diversity and general biology of different groups of living organisms. The learning outcomes of this course on invertebrates are:
To understand the form and function of major groups of invertebrates, with emphasis on adaptations, reproduction and development.
To familiarise the classification and phylogenetic relationships of the invertebrates.
To develop independent reading ability through weekly reading assignment of scientific papers in invertebrate biology.
本科是為主修生物學同學而設的“生物多樣性”課程的其中一個課程。本科為同學介紹生物多樣性和各類主要無脊椎動物的基本生物學。本科對無脊椎動物的學習果效為﹕
• 了解主要無脊椎動物的型態及功能，並着重其適應、生殖及發育。
• 熟識無脊椎動物之分類和種源關係。
• 透過每星期有關於無脊椎動物學文獻的閱讀作業，培養學生獨立閱讀能力。
courses.course_syllabus:
The morphology, ecology, reproduction, development, life history and phylogeny of major groups of invertebrates will be examined. The function of organ systems will be discussed with reference to the adaptations to the mode of life of the animals.

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Vertebrate Life
courses.description: Vertebrate Life is a course that deals with the evolution and phylogenetic relationships of vertebrates. This course will explore the morphological, anatomical, physiological, biochemical and behavioural characteristics of vertebrates, and discuss how these characteristics enable vertebrate animals to adapt to the environment and to maintain homeostasis. The life of vertebrates is a reflection of the adaptive strategies employed by vertebrate animals to secure success in the environment.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: LSCI1002 and BIOL2210 or permission of instructor (Not applicable to Old Curriculum students).
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To recognize the major groups of vertebrates and to understand their evolutionary history and phylogenetic relationships
2. To appreciate the diversity of morphological, anatomical, physiological and biochemical adaptations of vertebrates
3. To appreciate that vertebrate life is a reflection of the adaptive strategies employed by vertebrates for survival
4. Develop critical thinking skills in appreciating problems in vertebrate biology
5. Able to collect and critically analyze information from the primary literature
6. Develop critical reading and writing skills
1 認別主要脊椎動物組和明瞭其進化史和種系發育關係
2 領會脊椎動物在形態、解剖、生理和生化的適應多樣性
3 領會脊椎動物的生存是反映其適應策略
4 發展評論性思考以領會脊椎生物學的問題
5 能收集和評論性的分析初級文獻
6 發展評論性的閱讀和書寫技巧
courses.course_syllabus:
(1) Protochordates (2) Agnathans, development of jaws and fins, Gnathostomata (3) Evolution of the Chondrichthyes, Sarocopterygii and Actinopterygii (4) Evolution of air-breathing, swimbladder and aortic arches (5) Amphibia: origin and evolution, reproduction and development (6) Urodeles, anurans and caecilians (7) Origin of amniotic vertebrates, conquest of dry land: Reptilia (8) Extant reptiles: chelonians, squamates, crocodilians; Phylogeny of extinct reptiles: dinosaurs, pterosaurs (9) Aves; Archaeopteryx, birds as descendants of Archosaurs (10) Principles of bird flight, structural, physiological and biochemical considerations (11) Adaptive radiation in extant birds (12) Mammalian life, Prototheria and Metatheria (13) Adaptive radiation of extant eutherian mammals, Evolution of Primates
(1) 原索動物；(2) 無頜類、有頜類、頜和鮱的演化；(3) 軟骨魚類、肉鮱魚網和輻鰭魚網的演化；(4) 魚鰾呼吸空氣和主動脉弓的演化關係；(5) 兩棲類的起源、演化、繁殖和發育 (6) 有尾目、無尾目和無足目；(7) 羊膜脊椎動物的起源、爬行類與征服乾陸；(8) 現存爬行動物多樣性、恐龍和翼龍的演化；(9) 鳥類為祖龍的後代、始祖鳥；(10) 鳥類的飛行原理、結構、生理和生化特徵；(11) 鳥類的適應輻射；(12) 原獸、後獸和真獸的適應輻射；(13) 靈長類的演化。

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Animal Physiology
courses.description: Physiology is the study of body functions. Using both integrative and comparative approaches, this course covers different functions of animals such as neural conduction and integration, endocrine communication, muscle contraction, circulation, respiration, excretion, reproduction, etc., and the maintenance of a stable internal environment. The adaptive and evolutionary changes in different groups of animals are also discussed and compared.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken FNSC4101. Prerequisite: BIOL2120 and BCHE2030.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The students are expected to develop a good understanding of the basic physiological concepts and principles underlying the functions of each major organ system as well as the body as a whole. After completion of the course, the students are supposed to have learnt and understand the following key issues and principles of animal physiology, which will be essential for them to pursue a career in teaching, research in the areas of animal biology and biomedical sciences, as well as biotech and biomedical industry.
修读本科目的学生应掌握动物生理学的基本概念和原理，全面了解动物体各主要器官系统以及整体的功能。这些知识将有助于未来从事生物学教学、与动物学和生物医学有关的研究、以及生物及生物医学产品研发等。
courses.course_syllabus:
Introduction
- Scope of physiology
- Some history on animal physiology
- Scaling, homeostasis, cellular communication
- Membrane potential
Neuronal Physiology
- Graded potentials
- Action potentials
- Electrical and chemical synapses
- Neural signaling
Nervous System
- Classes of neurons
- Sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous system
- Blood-brain barrier
- Structure and functions of brain
- Short-term and long-term memory
- Short-term and long-term memory (Cont)
- Sleep
Sensory Physiology I
- Somatosensory pathway
- Mechanoreception (touch and hearing)
- Chemoreception (taste and smell)
- Photoreception (sight)
Endocrinology
- Classes of hormones
- Hypothalamic-hypophyseal portal system
- Thyroid glands and thyroid hormones
- Endocrine control of fuel metabolism, stress responses and calcium metabolism
Muscle Physiology
- Categorisation of muscles
- Structural organisation of a sarcomere
- Molecular basis of skeletal muscle contraction
- Control of skeletal muscle contraction (force and frequency)
- Skeletal muscle metabolism and fibre types
- Smooth and cardiac muscles
Cardiovascular System
- The heart and the cardiac cycle (electrical and mechanical events)
- Cardiac output and its control
- Open and closed circulatory systems
- Blood vessels and blood pressure
- Distribution of blood and its regulation
- The blood and its functions
- Haemopoiesis
- Clotting and platelet plug formation
Respiratory System
- Respiratory processes
- Air and water respirers
- Respiratory mechanics
- Circulatory transport and gaseous exchange
- Oxygen-haemoglobin dissociation curve
- Control of respiration
Excretory System
- Selective retention and excretion of materials
- Excretory organs
- Nephron structure and functions-Glomerular filtration, tubular reabsorption, tubular secretion and osmoconcentration
- Bladder storage and micturition
Digestive System
- Sensors and effectors of the digestive system
- Mastication and salivary secretion
- Gastric storage, mixing and emptying
- Control of gastric secretions
- Digestive accessory organs and their secretions
- Structure of a villus
- Segmentation and migrating motility complex
- Small intestine, digestion and absorption of nutrients
- Haustral & peristaltic contractions and mass movements
- Coprophagy in some animals
Reproductive System
- Asexual and sexual reproduction
- Oviparity, ovoviviparity and viviparity
- Male and female reproductive physiology
- Parturition and lactation

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Marine Biology

meetings.instructor:
Professor CHUI Pui Yi, 
Professor TSANG Ling Ming

Professor CHUI Pui Yi, 
Professor TSANG Ling Ming

courses.description: This course gives an introduction to the physical and chemical aspects of the marine environment, and to life in the oceans and coastal waters. The major groups of marine organisms will be treated, with a consideration of the factors influencing their distribution and abundance. Productivity of the marine environment and its present and future utilization by man will also be discussed.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge:
- An understanding of fundamental concepts in marine ecology, marine animal and plant physiology and biology, including those of algae, seagrass, mangroves, plankton, corals, fish, turtles, sea birds, mammals and other intertidal and subtidal organisms.
- Adaptations of marine planktonic and benthic organisms to their environment.
Skill:
- An introduction to approaches to analysis of data, search for online information, interpretation of results and experimental designs to carry out marine biological research.
Value:
- An appreciation of the diversity and wonders of the marine environment, especially the biology of the organisms that live in it and how they interact with the environment.
- An understanding of how the marine environment is closely related to our lives.
學習成果：
知識：
- 理解海洋生態、海洋動、植物生理學和生物學的基本概念，包括藻類、海草、紅樹林、浮游生物、珊瑚、魚類、海龜、海鳥、哺乳動物和其他潮間帶和潮下帶生物。
- 海洋浮游和底棲生物對他們的環境的適應。
技巧：
- 探討進行海洋生物研究的方法，包括數據分析、解釋，網上搜索資料與實驗設計。
價值：
- 欣賞海洋生物的多樣性和其奧妙，尤其是各種生物如何與環境互動。
- 了解海洋環境如何跟我們的生活息息相關。
courses.course_syllabus:
Topics: Contents/ fundamental concepts
1. Introduction to the Marine Environment: Physical and chemical forces that shape the marine environment.
2. Plankton Biology: Ecology and adaptations of plankton organisms.
3. Benthic Communities: Fundamental processes in the marine benthic environment, interactions between marine organisms and their physical and chemical environment in different marine habitats.
4. Estuaries: Meeting of freshwater and marine environments, fundamental adaptation of organisms in this unique habitat.
5. Marine fish, marine mammal and seabird: Behaviour, adaptation and physiological ecology of marine fish, mammals and seabirds
１．海洋環境簡介: 塑造了海洋環境的物理和化學力量。
２．浮游生物: 浮游生物的生態與其適應方式。
３．底棲生物群落: 海洋底棲環境的基本變化過程，海洋生物之間的相互作用及不同的海洋生境的物理和化學環境。
４．河口: 淡水和海洋之相 匯，在這個獨特棲息地的生物對環境之基本適應。
５．海洋魚類、海洋哺乳動物和海鳥: 海洋魚類、海洋哺乳動物和海鳥的行為、適應性和生理生態。

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Evolutionary Biology
courses.description: This course introduces students to the pattern and processes of evolution. The course begins with an introduction of the history and philosophy of evolutionary ideas, followed by the genetics of adaptation, natural selection and speciation, and then on to the geological record and the fossil record of origination and extinction, and finishes with a morphology-focussed discussion of phylogenetics and the molecular basis of evolution. Case studies on the use of different data in the study of evolutionary processes, biogeography and the history of life (including dinosaur evolution) will be included. This course is specially designed for advanced level of undergraduates, not only because of the course content, but it requires the students to think and integrate knowledge learnt from different courses in biology, molecular biology, cell biology, biotechnology, genetics, ecology, etc. In addition, a project will be initiated by students based on their own interests that will be completed by searching for and synthesising ideas and knowledge from diverse channels not only limited to scientific journal articles. Furthermore, a lab practical is organized so students can apply what they have learnt in class. Students will also be quizzed during tutorials about course sections and project work. These course features will help students to understand and analyse the problems from various aspects and multiple angles. Feedbacks will be provided throughout the course at different checkpoints
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: BIOL2210 or BIOL2310 or BIOL2410.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge
understand the key concepts in evolutionary biology
understand and evaluate the research methods in evolutionary biology
understand the morphology-based phylogenetics
understand the molecular basis of evolution and the use of
different
data in studies on evolutionary processes, biogeography, and the history of life
understand the linkage between the modern theory of evolution and other biological disciplines such as zoology, botany, genetics, ecology and molecular biology
Skill
understand and communicate ideas in biological evolution to individuals with or without scientific background
Value
Appreciate the importance of evolutionary analysis in areas including medicine, conservation biology and
palaeontology
Familiar with important questions and key issues in evolutionary biology
知識
o 明白演化生物學的關鍵概念
o 理解及評價演化生物學的研究方法
o 理解系統發育學 (特別關於形態數據)
o 明白演化論的分子基礎及理解不同數據在研究演化進程、生物地理學與生命歷史中的應用
o
理解現代演化學理論與其他生物學科
(
如動物學、植物學、基因學、生態學和分子生物學
)
的關聯
技巧
o 能和其他有或者沒有科學學術背景的人討論及交流生物演化論的見解
價值
價值
o 領會演化論在醫學、環保科學及古生物學中的重要性
o
熟悉演化生物學內的關鍵問題及焦點
courses.course_syllabus:
Evidence/Pattern of Evolution
Darwinian Natural Selection
Mutation & Genetic Variation
Mechanisms of Evolution: Selection & Mutation
Migration, Genetic Drift & Non-Random Mating
Evolution at Multiple Loci: Linkage & Sex
Quantitative Genetics
Sexual Selection & Kin Selection
Morphology-based Phylogenetics
Speciation
History of Life
Evolution of Genes & Genome
Evolution & Development
Students are expected to revise their
learning
materials after every single lecture, as the concepts keep building on each other as the course proceeds.
Students will get the chance to conduct independent research on a topic of their own interest for their course project.
Students will appreciate the importance of evolutionary analysis in other disciplines such as medicine, conservation biology and
palaeontology
; and also get familiar with important questions and key issues in evolutionary biology.

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Field and Environmental Biology
courses.description: This course provides an opportunity for students to conduct field related exercises in the aquatic and terrestrial environments. Students will develop the practical skills in ecological and environmental evaluation of different habitats as well as learn the techniques used in data analysis. Field trips to different habitats will normally be conducted during Saturdays.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge:
Integration of theory and practice in environmental biology through field exercises.
Skills:
An understanding of basic methods in field and environmental research, data analysis and project coordination and presentation skills.
Values:
- An appreciation of the wonder of the environment through fieldtrips and site visits.
- An understanding of how our environment is closely related to our lives.
學習成果：
知識：
透過野外考察，實踐環境生物學的理論。
技巧：
理解野外及環境研究的基本方法，培養數據分析、項目協調和資訊通報表達的能力。
價值觀：
- 透過實地考察，體會及鑒賞大自然的奧妙。
- 了解自然環境如何跟我們的生活息息相關。
courses.course_syllabus:
Topics: Contents/ fundamental concepts
1. Introduction to the Marine Planktonic Environment.
- Physical and chemical dynamics in the marine environment
- Ecology and adaptations of plankton organisms
2. Marine Benthic Communities
- Interactions, community and population processes in marine benthic environment, including the coral reef and rocky shores
- Biodiversity of marine benthic community and its conservation
3. Freshwater System and Estuaries
- Fundamental adaptation of organisms in the freshwater and estuarine habitats
4. Terrestrial Vegetation of Hong Kong
- Distribution, diversity and adaptation of terrestrial in a subtropical environment like Hong Kong
- Conservation of Hong Kong terrestrial habitats

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Developmental Biology
courses.description: This course deals with the principles and concepts of developmental biology. Topics include analysis of fundamental embryological process and consideration of major developmental biological problems such as cell fate determination, cell differentiation, pattern formation, morphogenesis, organogenesis, hormonal and environmental control of development in model organisms. Selected current topics and technology in developmental biology will also be discussed.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Students will acquire fundamental concepts and knowledge of developmental biology including cell fate determination, cell differentiation, body pattern formation, morphogenesis, organ formation, the molecular regulatory mechanisms of different developmental processes in different model organisms.
2. Students will acquire ability to comprehend the implication and application of developmental biology in the medical and biotechnology field.
3. Students will be introduced to the critical experimental evidence and current technology that has led to the formulation of the central concepts and novel findings in developmental biology. Thus, the students can learn how a biological question can be solved through experimental design and process.
4. Students will acquire skills in literature survey from various sources, analytical and problem solving skills through the course assessment.
5. This course equips students with the essential knowledge for studying the more advanced degree in biological science.
6. Students will acquire an educated mind and responsible attitude to judge on the application of latest developmental biological technique and findings in medical and biotechnology field for the good of human society and natural environment.
1. 學生將會習得發育生物學的基本概念及知識，包括模式生物的發育過程中的細胞命運決定、細胞分化、模式形成、形態發生、器官形成及分子控制機制。
2. 學生將能夠理解發育生物學在醫學及生物技術領域中的功能與應用。
3. 學生將會學到對建構發育生物學的核心概念及新發現有重大影響的實驗和當前技術。由此，學生能學習透過設計和進行實驗去解決生物學問題。
4. 學生將透過本科的評核，學習搜集資料進行文獻研究、分析及解決問題的技巧。
5. 本科教授學生修讀生物科學高級學位的必要知識。
6. 學生將會獲得足夠知識及負責任的態度，以社會及自然環境的利益為依歸，評核發育生物學應用於醫學及生物技術領域的最新技術和發現。

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Global Change Biology

meetings.instructor: Professor Shelby Eileen MC SHARRY MC ILROY
Professor Shelby Eileen MC SHARRY MC ILROY
Professor Shelby Eileen MC SHARRY MC ILROY

courses.description: This course will discuss the impact of global environmental changes on biological systems and their ecosystem services. We will focus on how global warming, and associated changes such as altered rainfall, sea level rise, and ocean acidification, have changed the biological communities of the Earth’s various ecosystems, from forests to coral reefs. The impact at biological levels from molecules to cells, organisms, populations, and communities will be explored. Models for projecting future changes in Earth systems, biological communities and ecosystem services under climate change will be introduced. While the major focus is on climate change, other aspects of global environmental change, such as habitat deterioration, will also be considered. Students are required to present case studies of global change biology based on latest research findings.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge
• An understanding of fundamental topics in global change biology, including: the Earth system; changes in the physiology of organisms under altered environmental conditions; community and ecosystem responses; the human aspect; multiple stressors
• A recognition of the links between impacts on different levels of biological organization; from molecules to cells, organisms, populations, and communities
Skill
• Development of generic skills necessary in Life Science fields including the ability to research a topic independently, find and synthesize information from literature, ask critical questions
• An introduction to approaches used to project future climates and organism/ecosystem responses
Value
• An appreciation of current environmental changes that are unique relative to other periods in Earth history, and how these changes may impact ecosystem services that humans rely upon
• Recognition that local human actions may mitigate largely-unmanageable effects of global change
知識
• 對全球變化生物學有基礎的認知，包括：地球系統、環境條件改變帶來的生物生理機能變化、群落與生態系統對環境變化的響應、全球變化對人類的影響和多重應激源。
• 理解全球變化對不同生物水平：分子、細胞、個體、種群、群落的影響以及不同層面之間的聯系。
技能
• 培養生命科學領域的基本技能，包括：獨立從事科研的能力、閱讀文獻並總結運用的能力和批判性思考的能力。
• 了解生命科學技術方法，用於預測未來氣候變化及生物體或生態系統對其的響應。
價值
• 認知目前地球史上前所未有的環境變化及其對人類所依附的生態系統造成的影響。
• 領會到即使是局部地區的人類在行為上做出改變也可以有效地緩解棘手的全球變化。
知识
• 对全球变化生物学有基础的认知，包括：地球系统、环境条件改变带来的生物生理机能变化、群落与生态系统对环境变化的响应、全球变化对人类的影响和多重应激源。
• 理解全球变化对不同生物水平：分子、细胞、个体、种群、群落的影响以及不同层面之间的联系。
技能
• 培养生命科学领域的基本技能，包括：独立从事科研的能力、阅读文献并总结运用的能力和批判性思考的能力。
• 了解生命科学技术方法，用于预测未来气候变化及生物体或生态系统对其的响应。
价值
• 认知目前地球史上前所未有的环境变化及其对人类所依附的生态系统造成的影响。
• 领会到即使是局部地区的人类在行为上做出改变也可以有效地缓解棘手的全球变化。
courses.course_syllabus:
I. Introduction – understanding the Earth system
1. The Earth system and natural/historical drivers and patterns of change (both in terms of climate, and biological responses)
2. Major features of present/future climate, including human-driven change (scenarios, models, validation, projections)
3. Approaches to monitor current and anticipate future biological change
II. Changes in organism physiology under altered conditions
1. Photosynthesis
2. Nutrient- and water-use efficiencies
3. Growth and reproduction
4. Phenology
5. Plant/algal quality and defenses
III. Community and ecosystem impacts of human-driven change
1. Population responses – e.g. range shifts
2. Community responses – e.g. alteration of species interactions; composition and diversity; parasites and pathogens
3. Ecosystem change – e.g. regime shifts; changes in net primary productivity, respiration, net ecosystem productivity, and nutrient cycling
IV. The human aspect
1. Anticipated impacts on humans – ecosystem services
2. Implications for conservation (adaptation of strategies, connectivity and landscape management, species management)
3. International policy (international climate policy, mitigation, carbon sinks and sources, assessing risks and designing solutions)
V. Additional considerations – multiple stressors
1. Non-climate change – e.g. habitat deterioration, pollution, over-fishing, species introductions, development
2. Interactive effects and feedbacks
3. Implications for management (rehabilitation and recovery)
I. 引言 – 了解地球系統
1. 地球系統、自然與由來已久的驅動力以及變化趨勢（在氣候和生物反應兩方面）
2. 現時和未來氣候的主要的特征，包括人為驅動的變化（前景、模型、驗證、推測）
3. 記錄當前和預測未來生物變化的方法
II. 生物生理機能隨環境條件變化的轉變
1. 光合作用
2. 吸收養分和水的性能
3. 成長與繁殖
4. 生物氣候學
5. 植物和藻類的性質與防禦機制
III. 人為驅動變化對生物群落和生態系統的影響
1. 種群反應（例：區域變動）
2. 群落反應（例：種間關系的改變 、結構與多樣性、寄生物與病原體）
3. 生態系統的變化（例：生態系統穩態轉換以及凈初級生產力、呼吸作用、凈生態系統生產力和養分循環的變化）
IV. 對人類的影響
1. 預期對人類的影響——生態系統服務功能
2. 對於環保的意義（策略的采用、不同生境之間的連通性與景觀管理、物種管理）
3. 國際政策（國際氣候政策、局勢緩解、碳匯與碳源、風險評估、解決措施）
V. 其他考量——多重應激源
1. 非氣候變化（例：生境惡化、汙染、過度捕撈、外來物種入侵、城市發展）
2. 交互作用和反饋
3. 對於管理的意義（重建和修復）
课程大纲
I. 引言 – 了解地球系统
1. 地球系统、自然与由来已久的驱动力以及变化趋势（在气候和生物反应两方面）
2. 现时和未来气候的主要的特征，包括人为驱动的变化（前景、模型、验证、推测）
3. 记录当前和预测未来生物变化的方法
II. 生物生理机能随环境条件变化的转变
1. 光合作用
2. 吸收养分和水的性能
3. 成长与繁殖
4. 生物气候学
5. 植物和藻类的性质与防御机制
III. 人为驱动变化对生物群落和生态系统的影响
1. 种群反应（例：区域变动）
2. 群落反应（例：种间关系的改变 、结构与多样性、寄生物与病原体）
3. 生态系统的变化（例：生态系统稳态转换以及凈初级生产力、呼吸作用、凈生态系统生产力和养分循环的变化）
IV. 对人类的影响
1. 预期对人类的影响——生态系统服务功能
2. 对于环保的意义（策略的采用、不同生境之间的连通性与景观管理、物种管理）
3. 国际政策（国际气候政策、局势缓解、碳汇与碳源、风险评估、解决措施）
V. 其他考虑——多重应激源
1. 非气候变化（例：生境恶化、污染、过度捕捞、外来物种入侵、城市发展）
2. 交互作用和反馈
3. 对于管理的意义（重建和修复）

courses.description: This course discusses the techniques and procedures of evaluating environmental consequences arising from human activities, with focus on their application in Hong Kong as prescribed under the Hong Kong Environmental Impact Assessment Ordinance, and its Technical Memorandum. Students are encouraged to take the laboratory course (BIOL4242) together with the lecture in order to have a better integration of theories and practical experiences on the subject.

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Environmental Impact Assessment Laboratory
courses.description: This laboratory course accompanies the lecture course BIOL4240 and provides hands-on exercises on selected techniques used in environmental impact assessment (EIA). Students will critically review a current EIA report with respect to its soundness in the application of EIA methodologies and the evaluation of assessment results. They will also gain first-hand experience on how to carry out an EIA by working on a small scale EIA project focusing on specific components of impact assessment.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken ENSC4242. Co-requisite: BIOL4240.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students completing this course are expected to:
obtain a first hand understanding of how Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) works in Hong Kong by reviewing and critically evaluating existing Hong Kong EIA reports;
gain hands-on experiences on how some EIA protocols are carried out;
develop the practical skills of doing an EIA by getting involved in actual preparation of a project profile, study brief and by actually carrying out a small scale EIA project;
learn from the experiences of front-line practitioners of EIA in Hong Kong by engaging in sharing and discussion with them during guest presentations;
strengthen their communication skills through oral presentation and report writing.
完成本科的學生將：
通過檢討和批判性評估香港現有的環境影響評估（EIA）報告，從而了解環境影響 評估報告之運作;
了解環境影響評估的規則；
通過實際編制工程項目簡介、研究概要和實際開展了小規模的環境影響評估項目， 培養實際進行環境影響評估的技巧；

courses.description: This course aims to provide an in-depth discussion of problems and solutions of environmental and biodiversity conservation, including student presentations on endangered species around the globe. Students taking this course need to have fundamental knowledge of biology and ecology. Major topics include conservation genetics, techniques in assessing biodiversity, global biodiversity loss, design and role of reserves and protected areas, wildlife conservation, habitat restoration and conservation policy and laws. Emphasis will be given to problems of critical importance to Hong Kong and the world today.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken ENSC4260. Pre-requisite: BIOL2210.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to appreciate the importance of biodiversity and realize the current biodiversity loss as a major global environmental issue. They will understand the ecological principles in management of biodiversity, threats to biodiversity and values of biodiversity. In the management aspects, students will know the assessment method for deciding the endangered status of a species and thus formulate the proper conservation plan for a species. Students will know the principles of conservation practices in situ and ex situ for terrestrial and aquatic organisms and habitats. Also, students have to learn the basic principles of restoration ecology for conserving lives. Besides, students are required to make a group presentation on an endangered species in the IUCN Red List.
Learning outcomes to be achieved:
Examinations: All the learning outcomes listed above on the basic concepts of biodiversity and environmental conservation, including the I&D component (10%) such as design of conservation planning of endangered species, including protected areas, as well as GC&SE component (30%) such as biodiversity loss as a major global environmental issue and the responsibility of mankind in conservation.
Presentation: Presentation usually focuses on an endangered species on the IUCN Red List, where the students review the basic biology of the species, and understand how it becomes endangered and what has been and could be done to protect the species, all of which involve I&D (10%) and GC&SE components (40%).
More focus on the global issue of biodiversity loss; with the use of examples of conservation management from different parts of the world. The design of conservation planning of endangered species, including protected areas, is the component of the course related to I&D. Through presentations on endangered species on the IUCN Red List, students will comprehend the policy and social issues of biodiversity conservation in different parts of the world, thus implementing GC&SE.
10% on Innovation & Design and 35% on Global Citizenship & Social Enterprisingness
courses.course_syllabus:
Introduction to conservation biology
What is biodiversity and how to measure it?
Impact on biodiversity: habitat destruction & fragmentation, overexploitation, biological invasion, climate change
What are the endangered statuses of a species?
How to assess the endangered status?
Conservation of population and species
What is conservation genetics?
How to assess genetic diversity?
Conservation of habitat and landscape
Restoration ecology

courses.description: This course is designed for students who are interested in human genetics. Students enrolled in this course will study the principles of inheritance which concern with the most interesting organism – the human being. Topics include the structure of the human genome (chromosomes), different modes of inheritance, epigenetics, variations and their uses in human genetics studies, aberrations and diseases, and genetics of various biological processes or diseases. The future outlook of human genetics and practical applications will also be discussed.
courses.course_syllabus:
1 Introduction to human genetics / How dynamic is our genome?
2 Human chromosomes and the Human Genome project
3 Repetitive sequences and Telomeres
4 Mendelian inheritance and extensions and exceptions to Mendel's Laws
5 Epigenetics
6 Complex genetic traits
7 Polymorphisms (variations) and aberrations
8 Mutation and genetic diseases
9 Genetics of the mind (behavior)
10 Genetics of immunity
11 Genetics of cancer
12 Genetic testing, genetic counselling, and beyond

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Marine Microbial Ecology
courses.description: This course brings the students to the marine microbial biosphere. Microbes are the engines that drive carbon and nutrient cycles in the ocean, and influence the health of marine plants and animals. In this course, we will discuss major concepts in ecological studies of microbes in the ocean, the way microbes function in their natural environments, and how their activities influence ecosystem functioning, global climate and the Earth as human habitat.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge
• Understand key concepts in marine microbial ecology
• Know the power of modern biotechnology in driving marine microbial ecology
• Comprehend important questions and key issues in marine microbial ecology
Skill
• Application of scientific method to marine microbial ecology
• Search for information from primary literature
• Critical analysis of information from primary literature
• Presentation and communication of ideas in marine microbial ecology using charts, graphs, diagrams and tables
Value
• Appreciate marine microbial roles in climate change and regulation
• Understand microbial roles in marine animal and plant conservation
• Recognize marine microbes as a source of novel metabolites for industrial application

• 瞭解微生物在海洋動植物保育中的作用
• 認識海洋微生物是新型代謝產物的重要來源
知识

courses.title: Hong Kong Flora and Vegetation
courses.description: This course is aimed to train students with capacity in various aspects of local plants, including knowledge of plant taxonomy, skills of field studies, knowledge transfer of botany and career development. This course consists of lectures, field trips and independent projects.Every enrolled student is required to work on an independent project which includes essay and presentation. Marking scheme of the project essay include five scopes: 1. Definition / history / background; 2. Reviews on the current problem; 3. Suggested solutions or methodology; 4. Conclusion and prospective; 5. References. Each chapter should be supplemented with photographs, figures and tables. At the course end, each student is also required to present his / her project with PowerPoint.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students will learn how to:
- Identify common plant species in Hong Kong
- Identify the local vegetation types
- Understand the concept of plant nomenclature and the e-learning platforms of botanical database
- Acquire the identification skills of plants
- Understand and integrate botanical knowledge in career development

courses.description: This course is aimed at preparing biology students for a teaching career by providing them with the basic concepts and skills for teaching biology at secondary levels. The course is based on the model of pedagogical content knowledge (PCK), where effective teaching is construed as the integration and transformation of subject content knowledge (CK) and pedagogical knowledge (PK) in accordance with specific learners. The course is thus cotaught by biologists and biology educators, who will together work out the most accurate concepts and how they can be taught in the most effective ways for a range of difficult biology concepts at secondary levels.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students will
have accurate understandings of difficult biology concepts at secondary levels
recognize the common misconceptions of students in secondary biology and their likely causes
be able to use effective instructional strategies to tackle the misconceptions and difficult biology concepts for secondary students
have a good understanding of scientific investigations and nature of science relevant to secondary biology
完成課程後學生將能夠
:
對較困難的中學生物學概念有準確的認識
認識中學生在生物學習上常見的錯誤概念和其成因
能針對中學生常見的錯誤觀念作出有效教學
對與中學生物學相關的科學探究和科學本質有良好的理解
完成课程后学生将能够
:
对较困难的中学生物学概念有准确的认识
认识中学生在生物学习上常见的错误概念和其成因
能针对中学生常见的错误观念作出有效教学
对与中学生物学相关的科学探究和科学本质有良好的理解
courses.course_syllabus:
Each lecture will target one topic in secondary biology that is deemed difficult to secondary students. The core contents of each lecture include:
the important and difficult concepts in the topic
the relevant misconceptions held by students and their likely causes
effective instructions for these difficult concepts
experiments (authentic and school) and nature of science related to the topic, with demonstrations and lab work when needed

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Fish Biology and Mariculture
courses.description: This course deals with the application of biological principles to the culture of marine fishes, crustaceans, molluscs and algae. Emphasis will be placed on the environmental, nutritional, reproductive and endocrine aspects in relation to current maricultural practice.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: LSCI1002 or consent of instructors.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The course is an advanced course for biology major students and aims to enhance students’ understanding on the scientific basis, principles and practice of mariculture with emphasis on fish. The course is particularly relevant for students intending to pursue careers in fisheries, aquaculture and related marine sciences, and those intending to take up careers in the Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation Department of the Hong Kong SAR Government.
The list of outcomes include:
1. Understanding the principles of culture practice of major groups of mariculture organisms, including local examples.
2. Understanding the biological aspects of fish and other culture organisms with relevance to their culture practice and improvements.
3. Developing critical thinking through studies on selected topics on mariculture, such as interactions between mariculture and environment, and biotechnological applications in mariculture.
本科是為主修生物學同學而設的高級課程，目的為加強同學對魚類及動物海產養殖的科學基礎、原理及實踐之了解。本科對有意從事漁業、水產養殖和相關海洋科學、及有意在香港特別行政區漁農自然護理處開展事業的同學尤其合適。
本科的學習果效為﹕
1. 了解海產養殖的原理，包括本地養殖的例子。
2. 了解與海產養殖相關的生物學。
3. 通過對海產養殖特選課題的學習，如海產養殖與環境的相互關係以及生物技術之應用，培養同學的批判性思考。
本科是为主修生物学同学而设的高级课程，目的为加强同学对鱼类及动物海产养殖的科学基础、原理及实践之了解。本科对有意从事渔业、水产养殖和相关海洋科学、及有意在香港特别行政区渔农自然护理处开展事业的同学尤其合适。
本科的学习果效为﹕
1. 了解海产养殖的原理，包括本地养殖的例子。
2. 了解与海产养殖相关的生物学。
3. 通过对海产养殖特选课题的学习，如海产养殖与环境的相互关系以及生物技术之应用，培养同学的批判性思考。
courses.course_syllabus:
This course deals with the application of biological principles to the culture of marine fishes, crustaceans, molluscs and algae. Emphasis will be placed on the environmental, nutritional, reproductive and endocrine aspects in relation to current maricultural practice. Prerequisite: LSCI1002.
The course contents include:
1. General survey on mariculture practices, including oysters, mussels and other molluscs, penaeid shrimp and other crustaceans, fishes, seaweeds, polyculture and integrated systems
2. Biological basis of mariculture, with emphasis on fish nutrition, physiology and reproduction
3. The role of genetics and biotechnology in mariculture
本科介紹生物學原理在海洋魚類、甲殼類、軟體動物及藻類等養殖之應用，並討論環境、營養、生殖及內分泌各方面，以闡明生物學對海產養殖的貢獻。先修科目: LSCI1002
本科內容包括﹕
1. 海產養殖方法的概論，包括蠔、貽貝及其它軟體動物，對蝦及其它甲殼類動物，魚類，海藻，混養及組合系統
2. 魚類養殖生物學，包括魚類營養、生理及繁殖
3. 遺傳學及生物技術在海產養殖之角色
本科介绍生物学原理在海洋鱼类、甲壳类、软件动物及藻类等养殖之应用，并讨论环境、营养、生殖及内分泌各方面，以阐明生物学对海产养殖的贡献。先修科目: LSCI1002
本科内容包括﹕
1. 海产养殖方法的概论，包括蚝、贻贝及其它软件动物，对虾及其它甲壳类动物，鱼类，海藻，混养及组合系统
2. 鱼类养殖生物学，包括鱼类营养、生理及繁殖
3. 遗传学及生物技术在海产养殖之角色

courses.recommended_readings:
1. Beaumont, A., Boudry, P., Hoare, K. (2010) Biotechnology and genetics in fisheries and aquaculture. 2nd edition. Blackwell.
2. Cabrita, E., Robles, V., Herraez, P. (2009) Methods in reproductive aquaculture: marine and freshwater species. Boca Raton: CRC Press.
3. Finn, R. N., Kapoor, B. G. (2008) Fish larval physiology. Enfield: Science Publishers.
4. Hoar, W. S. and Randall D J (and others) 1969-2009. Fish Physiology, vol 1 – vol 20. New York: Academic Press.
5. Overturf, K. (2009) Molecular research in aquaculture. Ames, Iowa: Wiley-Blackwell.
6. Stickney, R. R. (2009) Aquaculture: an introductory text. 2nd Edition, Oxfordshire, Cambridge.
7. Wickins, J.F. and Lee, D.O’C. (2002) Crustacean Farming: Ranching and Culture. 2nd edition. Blackwell, Oxford

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Senior Experimental Project I
courses.description: In this course, students are required to carry out an independent research project. The project topic will be decided by the supervisor(s) or jointly by both the supervisor(s) and the student. To fulfill the course requirement, students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisors regularly and submit a research proposal at the end of the term.The students should take the initiative to discuss with their supervisors and come up with a topic for the research project. Students should first conduct a literature survey of their research project and identify the scientific questions they want to address, then design and perform the experiments for this project under the guidance of the supervisors and submit a research proposal at the end of the term.
courses.learning_outcomes:
On successful completion of this course, students should be able to:
1) Integrate the knowledge and skills learnt previously in other courses
2) Survey scientific literature relevant to their research project
3) Read scientific literature critically to identify the scientific questions or problems
4) Design independent research project to address the scientific questions
5) Acquire hands-on research techniques in conducting experiments
6) Improve their problem-solving abilities
7) Improve their skills in writing scientific proposal
8) Improve their sense of responsibility and team spirit
成功修畢此課程後，學生應可：
1) 應用在課堂中獲得的知識及技能
2) 搜尋文獻
3) 批判地閱讀及分析文獻的內容，並認知及思考當中的科學問題
4) 就自己的專題研究題目，設計實驗去解說科學問題
5) 操作各式的實驗
6) 提升其解決問題的能力
7) 提升其書寫研究計劃報告的能力
8) 提升其責任感及團體精神
courses.course_syllabus:
Students should take the initiative to discuss with their supervisor(s) and come up with a topic for the independent research project. The students should first conduct a literature survey of their research project and identify the scientific questions they want to address. Students then design and perform the experiments for this project under the guidance of the supervisor(s) and submit a research proposal at the end of the term.
學生須於學期開始前主動聯絡教授，並訂出研究課題。學生須就該研究課題搜尋相關文獻，並確定研究方向。學生須設計實驗及進行研究，並於學期結束前遞交一份研究計劃。

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Internship
courses.description: In this course, students have the opportunity to gain practical experience working in the government, private companies or non-governmental organizations. Internship projects can be held either locally or overseas, but must be approved by the Programme. Students are required to serve at least 160 hours and submit a written report for assessment.
courses.learning_outcomes:
On successful completion of this course, students should be able to:
1) Integrate the knowledge and skills learnt previously in other courses
2) Design, organize, schedule and execute individual or group projects
3) Acquire hands-on techniques in conducting experiments or special projects provided by the company where the interns join
4) Improve their problem-solving abilities
5) Improve their sense of responsibility and team spirit
6) Obtain empirical and out-of classroom experiences for career development
7) Improve their skills in writing reports
成功修畢此課程後，學生應可：
1) 應用在課堂中獲得的知識及技能
2) 設計、安排、計劃及執行指定的個人或團體項目
3) 操作實驗或專題項目
4) 提升其解決問題的能力
5) 提升其責任感及團體合作精神
6) 累積課堂以外的工作經驗
7) 提升其書寫報告的能力
courses.course_syllabus:
Students should search for their own internship position and submit relevant documents to the Programme for approval. Each intern is required to work in the approved company or laboratory on a scientific project for at least 5 weeks (160 hours) in summer. The progress of each student will be monitored by a supervisor from the Programme. At the end of the internship, students should give an oral presentation and submit a written report.
學生須自行尋找本地或海外的專題實習機會，並提交相關資料以取得學系認可。實習生須在暑期時到認可之公司或機構工作或參與研究項目，為期最少五星期(160小時)。學生進度由學系導師監察。實習完結後，學生須作口頭報告並提交書面報告。
There is no syllabus for this internship course. We will stress our emphasis on the I&D and GC&SE and regularly talk to our internship providers on their implementation. I suppose most internship projects will have SE, while overseas internship project will intrinsically have very strong GC component.
40% Innovation &Design and 40% Global Citizenship &Social Enterprisingness

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Field Study
courses.description: This course gives students an opportunity to supplement what they have learnt from biology courses in the format of a local or overseas field trip during summer. Students are required to submit a proposal, participate actively in all activities throughout the field trip, submit an individual report and present a seminar for assessment. The field trip must be approved by the Programme.
courses.learning_outcomes:
On successful completion of this course, students should be able to:
1) Integrate the knowledge and skills learnt previously in lectures
2) Acquire hands-on techniques in collecting samples and data from field
3) Develop data analysis and interpretation skills in scientific ways
4) Improve their problem-solving abilities
5) Improve their team spirit
6) Improve their a sense of responsibility
7) Think critically and logically to solve environmental/biological problems
8) Improve their skills in writing reports and giving oral presentation
成功修畢此課程後，學生應可：
1) 應用在課堂中獲得的知識及技能
2) 收取樣本及數據
3) 分析及以邏輯和科學的角度表述數據
4) 解決問題
5) 提升其團體合作精神
6) 提升其有責任感
7) 批判性地思考及合邏輯性地解決與環境科學/生物相關的問題
8) 提升其書寫報告及作口頭報告的能力
courses.course_syllabus:
The students should participate in an approved field trip to carry out a purposive task overseas or locally. They should submit a proposal, go on a field trip that lasts for 2-4 weeks, give an oral presentation and submit a written final report for assessment.
學生於暑期中須積極參與學系認可之本地或海外的實地考察。學生須提交研究計劃，進行為期兩至四週的實地考察，並於考察完結後作口頭報告並提交書面報告。
There is no syllabus for the course. We will aim at overseas field trip to see efforts in environmental protection and nature conservation abroad. We will include group projects and discussion during the field trip to implement I&D, and visit local university, NGO and community projects in nature and heritage conservation.
50% (in terms of student workload) that Innovation & Design and/or 40% Global Citizenship &Social Enterprisingness account for in this course.

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Seminar
courses.description: Students will survey the literature in their chosen field of research and present a critical seminar on the topic. Presentation topics can also be chosen from an area that is relevant to their research.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After finishing the course, students should be able to
(1) acquire core knowledge in biology and in-depth knowledge in a particular field of biological sciences for research.
(2) acquire life-long learning skills to be an independent researcher.
(3) acquire knowledge to plan research work.
(4) acquire generic skills such as analytical skills, communication skills and writing skills.
(5) acquire skills how to prepare manuscript for publication.

courses.subject: BIOL
courses.title: Thesis Research
courses.description: In this course, a student is required to meet with his/her supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the student's academic progress.
courses.learning_outcomes: Development of research skills, including field and/or laboratory studies and data analysis as related to the students' thesis research.
courses.course_syllabus:
- Identify a research topic
- Develop a research hypothesis
- Prepare a
research proposal
- Develop research methodology and experimental design
- Conduct an original
research
with impact in a specific field or subject
- Analyze experimental results and make appropriate data interpretation
- Prepare a research dissertation/thesis and related manuscripts for publication
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Discussion with students
2. Self-reflection of teacher(s)
3. Feedback from alumni
4. Feedback from Visiting Committee and regular programme reviews
